sentence.Network_en: I had to go back for my checkup; they'd lost my X-rays.
sentence.Network_cn: 我得回去再做一次体检。他们把我的X光片弄丢了。

sentence.Network_en: A stupid medical clerk had slipped the wrong tab on his X-ray.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个蠢笨的医护人员一不留神在他的X光片上贴错了标签。

entry.def: X-rays are a type of radiation that can pass through most solid materials. X-rays are used by doctors to examine the bones or organs inside your body and are also used at airports to see inside people's luggage.
An X-ray is a picture made by sending X-rays through something, usually someone's body.

example.ex: She was advised to have an abdominal X-ray.
example.tran: 她被建议拍一张腹部的X光片。

entry.tran: 给…拍摄X光片；对…进行X光检查
entry.def: If someone or something is X-rayed, an X-ray picture is taken of them.

example.ex: All hand baggage would be x-rayed...
example.tran: 所有的手提行李都要接受X光检查。

example.ex: They took my pulse, took my blood pressure, and X-rayed my jaw.
example.tran: 他们给我量了脉搏、血压，还给我的下颌拍了X光片。

means.word_mean: 1. obtaining images by the use of X rays
